body:
Users may have one-off, hacked externals for combinations that are otherwise impossible. This allows spack to make use of those.

It also fixes a bug (reported by @rblake on slack) with cmake externals on macos for users who set their default compiler to gcc. Previously, those users would get concretization every time a package depended on cmake, because the default cmake was %gcc, which is a conflict on macos.
title: external packages: do not check for conflicts
